message: Thanks for putting time in on this. I've been hoping for 0.8 for a while now.
So far plan consists of:
0.8 is working well forme
I could work on the Italian translation, if you don't have anyone else on that
Going to sit and have a beer and code and listen to the rain :)
Goal is to release tomorrow.
So this afternoon I'm going to be working on cleaning up django-registration to reach the 0.8 final release.
1. Pulling in new and update translations.
3. Making a sweep of open tickets here: https://bitbucket.org/ubernostrum/django-registration/issues?status=new&status=open
will do
And since I've got a project that's using it, figured I might as well make it official.
@ubernostrum rain is awesome. finally
Yeah.
2. Fixing the mock-request bug that breaks the unit tests on Django 1.3.
As such, feel free to point me at particular tickets or branches you'd like to see make it in :)
(though it's likely several of those will get wontfix'd or marked invalid)
@eykd The biggest hangups here have been being unemployed and away from computers this summer.
And not knowing whether I wanted to release this knowing class-based views landed in Django 1.3.
Thank you for your work. I'm updating French translation.
If you can get it done within the next 24 hours or so I'll include it.
Since they kinda obsolete the backend rewrite ;(
Anyway, be back in a little bit, need to migrate downtown.
@ubernostrum I implemented a backend yesterday, it was still nice, and I don't think obsoleted in 1.3, althought it could still be refactored
I like how django-tastypie does urls in classes, vs how the backends do urls, but stripes, bikeshed, etc
Just want to thank you - I haven't yet built a Django site that didn't use both django-profiles and django-registration. Your work is appreciated.

@ubernostrum https://github.com/maraujop/django-registration/ This is my fork of your project, It's got updated Spanish translation. The other major change I did was transaction control handling (read the comments) https://github.com/maraujop/django-registration/commit/1c4a06ea8a367acd49fc13f2d6ce823711aab983 But you might disagree with it.
@ubernostrum BTW, I'm glad you are back with the project, it was the first one I looked when got to Django. I think it is still one of the best documented and laid out Django apps out there.
@ubernostrum if you releasing tomorrow, how are we going to shape how django-registration is going to turn out?
Also, tomorrow isn't a hard deadline. But if it doesn't happen tomorrow, it can't happen until at least Sunday and probably Monday.
@myusuf3 By bringing to my attention anything you think needs to be in the release :)
https://bitbucket.org/ubernostrum/django-registration/changeset/4333a94d076b Whee!
And now coverage is a bit better.

hehe funny, I was searching something like django-registration for a project I'm doing today, and didn't wanted to choose it because it was aging! wanted something "fresh", but I guess I'll be able to use it soon :)
And now the only open tickets are for translations. So I think I can take a break :)
@ubernostrum: It might make sense to setup a project on transifex.net or webtranslateit.com
Might do that for the next release.
For now that's more time than I want to spend getting 0.8 out the door.
@ubernostrum did you see my version of transaction control handling? any comments about it?
I must be dense.  How do I install the .8 release version.
"tip"
tarball right now
from bitbucket
proper release yet
i dont believe that there's a "proper" reelas eyet

I did that and here's the output of setup.py install:  Writing /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/django_registration-0.8_alpha_1.egg-info.  Is the alpha portion just wrong?  Leads me to believe I've installed an old version rather than the proper .8 release.
ugh

One last question:  how do I change the URLs such that I can use http://domain.com/register rather than http://domain.com/accounts/register?  I tried removing accounts like so in urls.py:  (r'^$', include('registration.backends.default.urls')), but that returns a 404.

This seems to get me someplace, but I'm not sure if it's a total hack job or not.      url(r'^register/$', register,{'backend': 'registration.backends.default.DefaultBackend'}, name='registration_register'),
@ubernostrum, I'll send you 50 bucks if you release today!
OK, all the translation updates are in.
@ubernostrum, was issue tracking turned off on the Bitbucket repository?
pls peeps add simple templates to this app. I can provide them btw. I think it's will be very good for beginners. also will be great to integrate social_auth to it.
